payments.description: The list of payments to be added on the draft flow

fdr.description:
The value of the flow identifier.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoFlusso].

fdrDate.description:
The date related to the flow reporting.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.dataOraFlusso].

sender.description: The information related to the entity that will compile and send the published flow.

receiver.description: The information related to the entity that will receive the published flow.

regulation.description:
The description related to the regulation payment related to the flow.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.identificativoUnivocoRegolamento].

regulationDate.description:
The date of the regulation payment related to the flow.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.dataRegolamento].

bicCodePouringBank.description:
The BIC code of the bank where the regulation payment related to the flow will be poured.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.codiceBicBancaDiRiversamento].

totPayments.description:
The total number of payments to be included in the flow during the flow compilation.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.numeroTotalePagamenti].

sumPayments.description:
The total amount of payments to be calculated in the flow during the flow compilation.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.importoTotalePagamenti].

indexList.description: The list of payments indexes to be removed on the draft flow

path.description: The path reference for the specific error clause in the general response.

examples: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.
message.description: The descriptive message for the specific error clause in the general response.

errorId.description: The unique identifier that can be used for tracking request and error response.

httpStatusCode.description: The HTTP status code related to the error message.

httpStatusDescription.description: The descriptive name of the HTTP status code.

appErrorCode.description: The operational error code related to the error response

errors.description: The list of specific errors to show for the error response.

index.description: Unique index of the payment in the flow

iuv.description:
The value of the 'Identificativo Univoco Versamento' code related to the payment.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.identificativoUnivocoVersamento].

iur.description:
The value of the 'Identificativo Univoco Riscossione' code related to the payment in the flow.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.identificativoUnivocoRiscossione].

idTransfer.description:
The value of the transfer identifier related to the payment during the payment process.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.indiceDatiSingoloPagamento].

pay.description:
The value of the payment amount in decimal euro.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.singoloImportoPagato].

payStatus.description:
The value of the status of the payment in relation to ist completion.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.codiceEsitoSingoloPagamento].
The enumeration is mapped with the following values:
  • EXECUTED -> 0
  • REVOKED -> 3
  • STAND_IN -> 4
  • STAND_IN_NO_RPT -> 8
  • NO_RPT -> 9

payDate.description:
The value of the date of the payment in relation to its completion.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.datiSingoliPagamenti.dataEsitoSingoloPagamento].

id.description:
The identifier of the Creditor Institution receiver entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoRicevente.identificativoUnivocoRicevente.codiceIdentificativoUnivoco].

organizationId.description:
The domain identifier of the Creditor Institution receiver entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoDominio].

organizationName.description:
The fiscal name of the Creditor Institution receiver entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoRicevente.denominazioneRicevente].

type.description:
The type of the PSP sender entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoMittente.identificativoUnivocoMittente.tipoIdentificativoUnivoco].The enumeration is mapped with the following values:
  • LEGAL_PERSON -> G
  • ABI_CODE -> A
  • BIC_CODE -> B

id.description:
The identifier of the PSP sender entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoMittente.identificativoUnivocoMittente.codiceIdentificativoUnivoco].

pspId.description:
The domain identifier of the PSP sender entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoPSP].

pspName.description:
The fiscal name of the PSP sender entity.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [FlussoRiversamento.istitutoMittente.denominazioneMittente].

pspBrokerId.description:
The domain identifier of the PSP sender entity's Broker.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoIntermediarioPSP].

channelId.description:
The identifier of the PSP sender entity's Channel.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.identificativoCanale].

password.description:
The password of the PSP sender entity's Channel.
In the XML request for SOAP primitives, this field is mappable with the tag [NodoInviaFlussoRendicontazione.password].

get.description:
## Description:
Get health check and deployment-related information

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get single draft flow related to the PSP, searching by name (for internal process)
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search a single draft flow for a specific PSP. In order to do so, it is required to add the following search filters: - Creditor institution identifier: for filtering by specific organization - PSP identifier: for filtering by flow-related PSP - Flow name: for filtering by specific instance of the flow The result will contains a single element because there can be only one draft flow for each unique identifier.
Before executing the query, the search filters are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on creditor institution and PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
This API is used only by internal processes in FdR ecosystem. ## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | Y ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | N ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | Y ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read ***Cacheable*** | Y

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The creditor institution identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

delete.summary: Delete an existing draft flow and all related payments (for internal process)
delete.description:
## Description: This API permits to delete a draft flow and all the payments associated to it. The deletion process irreversibly removes the flow and all related payments, making it impossible to recover any data afterwards. This procedure frees the draft for the flow with a specific identifier, enabling the generation of a new revision from scratch.
Please note that in order to remove an existing flow and all the related payments, the flow must exist and be in draft, i.e. not be in PUBLISHED status. A published flow cannot be removed at all and can only be 'replaced' by the creation of a new revision of the same flow through the 'new flow creation' API, although the old revision will be present anyway.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP.
This API is used only by internal processes in FdR ecosystem. ## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | Y ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | N ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read and Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

post.summary: Create a new flow structure (for internal process)
post.description:
## Description: This API permits to generate a new flow for a specific creditor institution. The generated flow is only a structure that define the main fields and the guidelines related to the payments that must be added in the next operations.
The flow can only be created if no other flow exists in the CREATED or INSERTED state with the same identifier. If it is necessary to define a new version but you have a flow in the listed statuses, you must first publish the flow in draft status, or delete the flow completely via the API if you want to change it in its entirety.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular (but not limited) on creditor institution and PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
This API is used only by internal processes in FdR ecosystem. ## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3002** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] already exists with [%] status. **FDR-2002** | 400 | PSP Broker with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2003** | 400 | PSP Broker with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2004** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2005** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2006** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with PSP Broker with ID [%]. **FDR-2007** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with PSP with ID [%]. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3004** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] have field sender.pspId [%] that does not match with query param [%]. **FDR-3010** | 400 | Field fdr [%] does not match with query param [%]. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | Y ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | N ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

put.summary: Add one or more payments to an existing flow (for internal process)
put.description:
## Description: This API permits to add one or more payments to a given flow, previously created through the dedicated API. Newly added payments will be validated according to the indexes defined during the insertion process and according to the totality of the indexes of the payments already inserted in the same flow.
In addition, during the process of adding payments the relevant flow is updated, in particular by adjusting the computed values: these fields will include the updated count of the inserted payments and the total amount of payments added together.
Please note that in order to add a new payment, the flow must exist and be in draft, i.e. not be in PUBLISHED status. In order to add a payment to an already published flow, it is necessary to create a new revision of the same flow through the 'new flow creation' API.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
This API is used only by internal processes in FdR ecosystem. ## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3005** | 400 | There are one or more identical payment indexes in same request for flow with ID [%]. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. **FDR-3006** | 400 | One or more payment index already added on flow with ID [%]. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | Y ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | N ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

put.summary: Delete one or more payments from an existing flow (for internal process)
put.description:
## Description: This API permits to remove one or more payments from a particular flow, which were previously added via the dedicated API. The payments to be removed are indicated in the request via the index with which they were previously defined when they were added to the flow, and must all be present within the flow at the time of deletion.
In addition, during the process of removing payments the relevant flow is updated, in particular by adjusting the computed fields: these fields will include the updated count of the removed payments and the total amount of payments reduced by the amounts of the removed payments.
Please note that in order to remove an existing payment, the flow must exist and be in draft, i.e. not be in PUBLISHED status. In order to remove a payment from a flow that has already been published, it is necessary to create a new revision of the same flow through the 'new flow creation' API not including the affected payments.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP.
This API is used only by internal processes in FdR ecosystem. ## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3005** | 400 | There are one or more identical payment indexes in same request for flow with ID [%]. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. **FDR-3003** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] exists with [%] status. **FDR-3007** | 400 | Index of payment not match with index loaded on flow with ID [%]. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | Y ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | N ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

post.summary: Publish an existing flow in draft status (for internal process)
post.description:
## Description: This API permits to publish a flow in draft, completed and ready to be retrieved by the creditor institution related to the flow. The publication release a new revision of certain flow, permitting to generate a new version if required.
In addition, during the flow publication process a final validation of the "computed fields" is performed, checking that their values are equal to the values pre-defined in the creation phase of the empty flow. Please note that, in order to publish a flow, it must be in draft, so it must not be already in PUBLISHED status.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP.
This API is used only by internal processes in FdR ecosystem and, because of this, does not provide a historicization procedure: that task is demanded uniquely to external publish API. ## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. **FDR-3003** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] exists with [%] status. **FDR-4001** | 400 | On flow with ID [%], [%] payments were defined to be added but [%] were actually added. **FDR-4002** | 400 | On flow with ID [%], an amount of [%] euro for all payments were defined to be added but [%] is actually calculated. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | Y ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | N ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

get.summary: Get all flows related to PSP, only if contains a payment with specific IUR code
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search all the flows that contains a payment with specific IUR code (Identificativo Univoco Riscossione) in relation to a PSP.
The result of the query is paginated and contains all the metadata needed for pagination purposes.
This API is used for internal purpose in order to perform a deep-search for dedicated troubleshooting.

parameters.description: The payment's IUR code, used as a search filter
parameters.name: iur

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

parameters.description: The lower limit of the date related to the flow creation date
parameters.name: createdFrom

parameters.description: The upper limit of the date related to the flow creation date
parameters.name: createdTo

parameters.description: The index of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of the elements of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: size

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

The result of the query is paginated and contains all the metadata needed for pagination purposes.
This API is used for internal purpose in order to perform a deep-search for dedicated troubleshooting.

get.summary: Get all published flow related to creditor institution
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search all published flows for a specific creditor institution, formatted in a paginated view. The search can be enhanced including the PSP identifier in order to filter only the flows for certain PSP. The only flows retrieved are the latest revision, as same as "nodoChiediElencoFlussiRendicontazione" primitive does.
Before executing the query, the search filters are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP (if that search filter is defined).
The result of the query is paginated and contains all the metadata needed for pagination purposes.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | Y ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read ***Cacheable*** | Y

parameters.description: The creditor institution identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: A date to be used as a lower limit search on flow date. In format ISO-8601 (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss)
parameters.name: flowDate

parameters.description: The index of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

parameters.description: A date to be used as a lower limit search on publication date. In format ISO-8601 (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss)
parameters.name: publishedGt

parameters.description: The number of the elements of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: size

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get single published flow related to creditor institution, searching by name and revision
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search a single published flows for a specific creditor institution. In order to do so, it is required to add the following search filters: - Creditor institution identifier: for filtering by specific organization - PSP identifier: for filtering by flow-related PSP - Flow name: for filtering by specific instance of the flow - Revision: for filtering by flow revision Before executing the query, the search filters are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on creditor institution and PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | Y ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read ***Cacheable*** | Y

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The creditor institution identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

parameters.description: The specific revision of the flow needed
parameters.name: revision

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get all payments of single published flow related to creditor institution, searching by name and revision
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search all the payments of a single published flow for a specific creditor institution, formatted in a paginated view. In order to do so, it is required to add the following search filters: - Creditor institution identifier: for filtering by specific organization - PSP identifier: for filtering by flow-related PSP - Flow name: for filtering by specific instance of the flow - Revision: for filtering by flow revision Before executing the query, the search filters are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on creditor institution and PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
The result of the query is paginated and contains all the metadata needed for pagination purposes.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | Y ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read ***Cacheable*** | Y

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The creditor institution identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

parameters.description: The specific revision of the flow needed
parameters.name: revision

parameters.description: The index of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of the elements of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: size

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get all draft flows related to the PSP
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search all draft flows for a specific PSP, formatted in a paginated view. The only flows retrieved are the single draft revision, one for each flow identifier.
Before executing the query, the search filters are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP.
The result of the query is paginated and contains all the metadata needed for pagination purposes.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | Y ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read ***Cacheable*** | Y

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

parameters.description: A date to be used as a lower limit search on creation date. In format ISO-8601 (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss)
parameters.name: createdGt

parameters.description: The index of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of the elements of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: size

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get single draft flow related to the PSP, searching by name
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search a single draft flow for a specific PSP. In order to do so, it is required to add the following search filters: - Creditor institution identifier: for filtering by specific organization - PSP identifier: for filtering by flow-related PSP - Flow name: for filtering by specific instance of the flow The result will contains a single element because there can be only one draft flow for each unique identifier.
Before executing the query, the search filters are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on creditor institution and PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | Y ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read ***Cacheable*** | Y

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The creditor institution identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

delete.summary: Delete an existing draft flow and all related payments
delete.description:
## Description: This API permits to delete a draft flow and all the payments associated to it. The deletion process irreversibly removes the flow and all related payments, making it impossible to recover any data afterwards. This procedure frees the draft for the flow with a specific identifier, enabling the generation of a new revision from scratch.
Please note that in order to remove an existing flow and all the related payments, the flow must exist and be in draft, i.e. not be in PUBLISHED status. A published flow cannot be removed at all and can only be 'replaced' by the creation of a new revision of the same flow through the 'new flow creation' API, although the old revision will be present anyway.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read and Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

post.description:
## Description: This API permits to generate a new flow for a specific creditor institution. The generated flow is only a structure that define the main fields and the guidelines related to the payments that must be added in the next operations.
The flow can only be created if no other flow exists in the CREATED or INSERTED state with the same identifier. If it is necessary to define a new version but you have a flow in the listed statuses, you must first publish the flow in draft status, or delete the flow completely via the API if you want to change it in its entirety.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular (but not limited) on creditor institution and PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3002** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] already exists with [%] status. **FDR-2002** | 400 | PSP Broker with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2003** | 400 | PSP Broker with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2004** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2005** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2006** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with PSP Broker with ID [%]. **FDR-2007** | 400 | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with PSP with ID [%]. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3004** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] have field sender.pspId [%] that does not match with query param [%]. **FDR-3010** | 400 | Field fdr [%] does not match with query param [%]. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

put.summary: Add one or more payments to an existing flow
put.description:
## Description: This API permits to add one or more payments to a given flow, previously created through the dedicated API. Newly added payments will be validated according to the indexes defined during the insertion process and according to the totality of the indexes of the payments already inserted in the same flow.
In addition, during the process of adding payments the relevant flow is updated, in particular by adjusting the computed values: these fields will include the updated count of the inserted payments and the total amount of payments added together.
Please note that in order to add a new payment, the flow must exist and be in draft, i.e. not be in PUBLISHED status. In order to add a payment to an already published flow, it is necessary to create a new revision of the same flow through the 'new flow creation' API.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP. Also, the name of the flow is validated against a specific standard format.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3005** | 400 | There are one or more identical payment indexes in same request for flow with ID [%]. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. **FDR-3006** | 400 | One or more payment index already added on flow with ID [%]. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

put.summary: Delete one or more payments from an existing flow
put.description:
## Description: This API permits to remove one or more payments from a particular flow, which were previously added via the dedicated API. The payments to be removed are indicated in the request via the index with which they were previously defined when they were added to the flow, and must all be present within the flow at the time of deletion.
In addition, during the process of removing payments the relevant flow is updated, in particular by adjusting the computed fields: these fields will include the updated count of the removed payments and the total amount of payments reduced by the amounts of the removed payments.
Please note that in order to remove an existing payment, the flow must exist and be in draft, i.e. not be in PUBLISHED status. In order to remove a payment from a flow that has already been published, it is necessary to create a new revision of the same flow through the 'new flow creation' API not including the affected payments.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3005** | 400 | There are one or more identical payment indexes in same request for flow with ID [%]. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. **FDR-3003** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] exists with [%] status. **FDR-3007** | 400 | Index of payment not match with index loaded on flow with ID [%]. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

post.summary: Publish an existing flow in draft status
post.description:
## Description: This API permits to publish a flow in draft, completed and ready to be retrieved by the creditor institution related to the flow. The publication release a new revision of certain flow, permitting to generate a new version if required. After publication, specific metadata are saved in order to perform an asynchronous historicization of this flow, including all the payments related to it.
In addition, during the flow publication process a final validation of the "computed fields" is performed, checking that their values are equal to the values pre-defined in the creation phase of the empty flow. Please note that, in order to publish a flow, it must be in draft, so it must not be already in PUBLISHED status.
Before executing the operation, the request fields are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-3008** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a date that is not compliant. **FDR-3009** | 400 | Flow identifier [%] contains a PSP ID that is not compliant. **FDR-3001** | 404 | Flow with ID [%] not found. **FDR-3003** | 400 | Flow with ID [%] exists with [%] status. **FDR-4001** | 400 | On flow with ID [%], [%] payments were defined to be added but [%] were actually added. **FDR-4002** | 400 | On flow with ID [%], an amount of [%] euro for all payments were defined to be added but [%] is actually calculated. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | N ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Write ***Cacheable*** | N

parameters.description: The flow name, used as a search filter
parameters.name: fdr

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get all published flow related to the PSP
get.description:
## Description: This API permits to search all published flows for a specific PSP, formatted in a paginated view. The search can be enhanced including the creditor institution identifier in order to filter only the flows for certain receiver. The only flows retrieved are the latest revision, as same as "nodoChiediElencoFlussiRendicontazione" primitive does.
Before executing the query, the search filters are validated against entities configured for Nodo dei Pagamenti environment, in particular on PSP and creditor institution (if that search filter is defined).
The result of the query is paginated and contains all the metadata needed for pagination purposes.
## Error codes: APPLICATIVE CODE | HTTP CODE | MESSAGE - | - | - **FDR-2000** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2001** | 400 | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. **FDR-2008** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. **FDR-2009** | 400 | Creditor institution with ID [%] is not enabled. ## API properties: PROPERTY | VALUE - | - ***Internal*** | N ***External*** | Y ***Synchronous*** | Synchronous ***Authorization*** | Y (Authorizer) ***Authentication*** | Y (Subscription Key) ***TPS*** | 1.0/sec ***Idempotency*** | Y ***Stateless*** | Y ***Read/Write Intensive*** | Read ***Cacheable*** | Y

parameters.description: The PSP identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: pspId

parameters.description: The creditor institution identifier, used as a search filter
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: The index of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: A date to be used as a lower limit search on publication date. In format ISO-8601 (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss)
parameters.name: publishedGt

parameters.description: The number of the elements of the page to be shown in the result
parameters.name: size

errors.message: An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support.

info.title: FDR - Flussi di Rendicontazione
info.description:
Manage FDR (aka "Flussi di Rendicontazione") exchanged between PSP and EC ## OPERATIONAL ERROR CODES
Details NAME | CODE | ERROR MESSAGE TEMPLATE | DESCRIPTION - | - | - | - **FDR-0500** | *ERROR* | An unexpected error has occurred. Please contact support. | An error occurred during computation. This could be
caused by an applicative error and it is probably required
to open an issue. **FDR-1000** | *BAD_REQUEST* | Bad request. | A generic 'Bad Request' error is occurred during request
validation. **FDR-1001** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON* | Bad request. Field [%] is equals to [%] but this is
not a valid value. | A generic error occurred during execution of request
syntactic validation **FDR-1002** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_INSTANT* | Bad request. Field [%] is equals to [%] but it is expected
to be in ISO-8601 format [yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ] (example:
[2025-01-01T12:00:00.123000Z]. | An error occurred during execution of request syntactic
validation, in particular regarding the analysis of
date values **FDR-1003** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_ENUM* | Bad request. Field [%] is equals to [%] but it is expected
to be one of the following values: [%]. | An error occurred during execution of request syntactic
validation, in particular regarding the analysis of
enumerative values **FDR-1004** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_DESERIALIZE_
ERROR* | Bad request. Field [%] generate a deserialization error.
Please, set the correct value. | An error occurred during execution of deserialization
of request from a JSON string **FDR-1005** | *BAD_REQUEST_INPUT_JSON_NON_VALID_
FORMAT* | Bad request. The format of JSON request is not valid. | An error occurred during execution of analysis of JSON
request, in particular regarding its format **FDR-2000** | *PSP_UNKNOWN* | PSP with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP identifier.
That PSP is not valid and maybe it does not exists
in current environment **FDR-2001** | *PSP_NOT_ENABLED* | PSP with ID [%] is not enabled. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP identifier.
That PSP is not enabled and cannot be used for elaboration **FDR-2002** | *BROKER_UNKNOWN* | PSP Broker with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP Broker identifier.
That PSP Broker is not valid and maybe it does not
exists in current environment **FDR-2003** | *BROKER_NOT_ENABLED* | PSP Broker with ID [%] is not enabled. | An error occurred regarding the passed PSP Broker identifier.
That PSP Broker is not enabled and cannot be used for
elaboration **FDR-2004** | *CHANNEL_UNKNOWN* | Channel with ID [%] is invalid or unknown. | An error occurred regarding the passed Channel identifier.
That Channel is not valid and maybe it does not exists
in current environment **FDR-2005** | *CHANNEL_NOT_ENABLED* | Channel with ID [%] is not enabled. | An error occurred regarding the passed Channel identifier.
That Channel is not enabled and cannot be used for
elaboration **FDR-2006** | *CHANNEL_BROKER_WRONG_CONFIG* | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with

That Channel is not correctly configured for the passed
PSP Broker and cannot be used for elaboration. In order

operator **FDR-2007** | *CHANNEL_PSP_WRONG_CONFIG* | Channel with ID [%] is not authorized to be used with

and cannot be used for elaboration **FDR-3001** | *REPORTING_FLOW_NOT_FOUND* | Flow with ID [%] not found. | An error occurred during the search of reporting flow.
The needed flow does not exists in current environment **FDR-3002** | *REPORTING_FLOW_ALREADY_EXIST* | Flow with ID [%] already exists with [%] status. | An error occurred during the search of reporting flow.
The flow being created already exists in CREATED/INSERTED

must be deleted in order to create another flow with

to the one defined in the request. So, it is required
